header.title: {{name}}
header.short: Movie Search App — search, filters, persistent favorites and dynamic recommendations (TMDB).

summary.heading: Summary
summary.text: CineLab is an app designed for movie lovers. It allows searching movies, accessing details (ratings, synopsis), getting recommendations and managing favorites persistently. The project was a technical and creative challenge, focused on performance, accessibility and user experience.

problem.heading: Problem solved
problem.text: Many movie search apps have slow interfaces or lack persistence for favorites. The goal was to build a fast, accessible SPA with robust state handling, focused on frontend architecture best practices.

techTools.heading: Technologies and tools
techTools.text: Stack chosen for speed and good practices: React + Vite, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS. For integrations: TMDB API via Axios with interceptors and abort handling.
list: React with Vite (HMR and fast build).
Tailwind CSS for utility styles and visual consistency.
Context API + custom hooks (useApi, useLocalStorage, useFavorites).

architecture.heading: Architecture and decisions
architecture.text: Modularity and separation of concerns were prioritized: decoupled API services, hooks for fetching logic, and utilities for persistence. Global favorites state is handled with Context + reducer, avoiding prop-drilling.

implementation.heading: Highlighted implementation
implementation.hookDescription: This hook abstracts fetching logic, cancellation and loading handling, avoiding duplication and improving testability.

accessibility.heading: Accessibility
accessibility.lead: Roles and ARIA attributes were applied to interactive components (modals/dialogs, buttons). The app is keyboard navigable and meets contrast guidelines.
list: 100% keyboard navigation: all controls are keyboard accessible.
Focus visible: clear focus styles for interactive elements.
aria-label on icon-buttons without text: actions have descriptive aria-labels.
aria-live: live regions are used to report dynamic changes (e.g., carousel slide changes or favorites notifications).

performance.heading: Performance and results
list: Lighthouse: performance and accessibility 90+ (pending improvements: SSR, more aggressive caching).

challenges.heading: Challenges and learnings
list: Handling fetching with cancellation to avoid race conditions and memory leaks.
Synchronizing favorites with localStorage and its testing.
Modularity: reusable hooks and decoupled services made refactors easier.

improvements.heading: What I would improve
list: Infinite scroll in listings instead of manual pagination.
Consider SSR with Next.js for SEO and initial performance.
Explore React Query for caching and automatic synchronization.
